1.brief: to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
Achab, the name of a king of Israel and of a prophet at Babylon

2.brief: to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
Achazjah, the name of a Jewish and an Israelite king
in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.
a net-work, i.e. (in hunting) a snare, (in architecture) a ballustrade; also a reticulated ornament to apillar
something lofty, i.e. a stair-way; also a second-story room (or even one on the roof); figuratively, the sky
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
Shomeron, a place in Palestine
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
to say (used with great latitude)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship

the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Achazjah, the name of a Jewish and an Israelite king
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
